name: AmazonEC2
description: Amazon EC2 - resizable compute capacity in the cloud

params.name: accessKeyId
params.description: AWS Access Key ID for authentication

params.name: secretAccessKey
params.description: AWS Access Key secret for authentication.

settings.name: region
settings.description: An optional default AWS geographical region where resources will be managed

params.name: NAME_TAG
params.description: Set the "Name" tag of the created instance for easier future reference.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where instance will be created

params.name: IMAGE_ID
params.description: Amazon Machine Image (AMI) provides the base image (operating system) for the instance.

params.name: INSTANCE_TYPE
params.description: The machine type you want to launch for example: t2.micro

params.name: KEY_NAME
params.description: If specified, encrypt the volume created for this instance using the specified Key pair.

params.name: subnetId
params.description: If specified, host the instance on the specified Subnet.

params.name: SECURITY_GROUP_IDS
params.description: Connect this instance to a security group. You will have to use a code or configuration to transfer the array to the API

params.name: TAGS_SPECIFICATION
params.description: The tags to apply to the resources during launch.

params.name: USER_DATA
params.description: Option of passing user data to the instance that can be used to perform common automated configuration tasks and even run scripts after the instance starts.

params.name: MIN_COUNT
params.description: The minimum number of instances to launch (by default 1).

params.name: MAX_COUNT
params.description: The maximum number of instances to launch. The default is 1.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where instances will be started

params.name: INSTANCE_IDS
params.description: The IDs of the instances to start, one per line

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where instance will be stopped

params.name: INSTANCE_IDS
params.description: The IDs of the instances to stop, one per line

params.name: WAIT_FOR_STOP
params.description: Wait for the specified instances to stop.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where instance will be rebooted

params.name: INSTANCE_IDS
params.description: The ID of the instance(s) to reboot.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where instance will be terminated

params.name: INSTANCE_IDS
params.description: The ID of the instance(s) to terminate.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where instance will be described

params.name: INSTANCE_IDS
params.description: The IDs of the instances. Can be an array of instances.

params.name: filters
params.description: Array of filters

params.name: DRYRUN
params.description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response.

params.name: GET_ALL_RECURSIVELY
params.description: Check this if you want to more than 1000 instances at once.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where instance will be modified

params.name: instanceIds
params.description: Accepts either a string with one or multiple instance IDs each separated with a new line, or an array of instance ID strings passed from the code layer.

params.name: instanceType
params.description: The machine type you want to launch for example: t2.micro

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where instance attributes will be modified

params.name: instanceIds
params.description: Accepts either a string with one or multiple instance IDs each separated with a new line, or an array of instance ID strings passed from the code layer.

params.name: attributeValue
params.description: The new value of an attribute.

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where a key pair will be created

params.name: KEY_PAIR_NAME
params.description: A descriptive name for the Key pair.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where a key pair will be deleted

params.name: KEY_PAIR_NAME
params.description: The name of the Key pair to delete.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where a key pair will be described

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where an address will be allocated

params.name: ADDRESS
params.description: A specific address from a Bring your own IP (BYOIP) address pool, if using BYOIP and a specific address assignment is needed

params.name: PUBLICIPV4POOL
params.description: The ID of a Bring your own IP (BYOIP) address pool to select an arbitrary available address from that pool

params.name: DRYRUN
params.description: If enabled, this tests the allocation request with AWS to check for potential errors without actually allocating any address.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where an address will be associated with an instance

params.name: ALLOCATION_ID
params.description: The allocation ID of the address to be associated with an instance

params.name: INSTANCE_ID
params.description: The ID of the instance to which the address should be associated

params.name: NETWORK_INTERFACE_ID
params.description: The ID of a specific network interface, required only if the instance has more than one

params.name: PRIVATE_IP_ADDRESS
params.description: The private IP address to associate with the Elastic IP address, required only if the instance has more than one.

params.name: DRYRUN
params.description: If enabled, this tests the association request with AWS to check for potential errors without actually associating any address.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region of the address to be released

params.name: ALLOCATION_ID
params.description: The allocation ID of the address to be released

params.name: DRYRUN
params.description: If enabled, this tests the release request with AWS to check for potential errors without actually releasing any address.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) will be created

params.name: cidrBlock
params.description: The IPv4 network range for the VPC, in CIDR notation. For example, 10.0.0.0/16.

params.name: amazonProvidedIpv6CidrBlock
params.description: Requests an Amazon-provided IPv6 CIDR block with a /56 prefix length for the VPC. You cannot specify the range of IP addresses, or the size of the CIDR block.

params.name: instanceTenancy
params.description: The tenancy options for instances launched into the VPC. value can be "default" or ."dedicated".

params.name: createInternetGateway
params.description: If true, create an Internet gateway and attach it this VPC. Default value is false.

params.name: tags
params.description: If specified, tag all resources created(At least the VPC, more if checked the create box for any other resource) with the tags specified. Each tag should either be in the format of Key=Value or just Key. To enter multiple values seperate each with a new line. Also accepts getting an array of objects in the form of { Key, Value } or { Key }.

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) will be deleted

params.name: vpcId
params.description: The ID of the VPC.

params.name: dryRun
params.description: checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where a subnet will be created

params.name: vpcId
params.description: The ID of the VPC.

params.name: routeTableId
params.description: If specified, associate the subnet with the specified Route Table.Doesn't work together with the parameter 'Create Private Route Table'.

params.name: availabilityZone
params.description:
The Availability Zone or Local Zone for the subnet.Default(if not provided):AWS selects one for you. If you create more than one subnet in your VPC, AWS does not necessarily select a different zone for each subnet.
To create a subnet in a Local Zone, set this value to the Local Zone ID, for example us-west-2-lax-1a. For information about the Regions that support Local Zones, see Available Regions in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide. To create a subnet in an Outpost, set this value to the Availability Zone for the Outpost and specify the Outpost ARN.

params.name: cidrBlock
params.description: The IPv4 network range for the VPC, in CIDR notation. For example, 10.0.0.0/16.

params.name: ipv6CidrBlock
params.description: The IPv6 network range for the subnet, in CIDR notation. The subnet size must use a /64 prefix length.

params.name: outpostArn
params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost. If you specify an Outpost ARN, you must also specify the Availability Zone of the Outpost subnet.

params.name: allocationId
params.description: If specified, create a NAT Gateway within the subnet created, with the Elastic IP address of the specified Allocation.

params.name: createPrivateRouteTable
params.description:
If specified, it creates a new route table and connects it to the subnet.
In case a NAT Gateway was also created from this function, also create a default route from the route table to the NAT Gateway. This proccess needs to wait for the NAT Gateway to be available whichmight take a couple of minutes!

params.name: mapPublicIpOnLaunch
params.description: If specified modify the attribute 'Map Public IP On Launch' on the subnet to true, using this command: [documentaion](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSJavaScriptSDK/latest/AWS/EC2.Ifhtml#modifySubnetAttribute-property). The subnet will map a public ip address to any instance launched from it.

params.name: tags
params.description: If specified, tag all resources created(Subnet and maybe Nat Gateway) with the tags specified. Each tag should either be in the format of Key=Value or just Key. To enter multiple values seperate each with a new line. Also accepts getting an array of objects in the form of { Key, Value } or { Key }.

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where a subnet will be deleted

params.name: subnetId
params.description: The ID of the subnet.

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where a NAT Gateway will be created

params.name: subnetId
params.description: The subnet to create this NAT Gateway in.

params.name: allocationId
params.description: The allocation ID of an Elastic IP address to associate with the NAT gateway. If the Elastic IP address is associated with another resource, you must first disassociate it.

params.name: tags
params.description: If specified, tag the NAT Gateway with the tags specified. Each tag should either be in the format of Key=Value or just Key. To enter multiple values separate each with a new line. Also accepts getting an array of objects in the form of { Key, Value } or { Key }.

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where an Internet Gateway will be created

params.name: vpcId
params.description: If specified, attach the newly created Internet Gateway to the specified VPC.

params.name: tags
params.description: If specified, tag the Internet Gateway with the tags specified. Each tag should either be in the format of Key=Value or just Key. To enter multiple values seperate each with a new line. Also accepts getting an array of objects in the form of { Key, Value } or { Key }.

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where an Internet Gateway will be attached

params.name: gatewayId
params.description: The ID of the internet gateway to attach to the VPC.

params.name: vpcId
params.description: The ID of the VPC to attach the internet gateway to.

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where a route will be created

params.name: routeTableId
params.description: The ID of the route table to create the route in.

params.name: gatewayId
params.description: ID of an internet gateway. If specified, make the Internet Gateway specify the target of the route.

params.name: natGatewayId
params.description: ID of a NAT gateway. If specified, make the NAT Gateway specify the target of the route.

params.name: instanceId
params.description: ID of an Instance. If specified, make the Instance specify the target of the route.

params.name: destinationCidrBlock
params.description: This route will target all IPv4 addresses in the specified IP block.

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where a Route Table will be created

params.name: vpcId
params.description: The VPC to create this Route Table in.

params.name: subnetId
params.description: If specified, associate the created Route Table with the specified Subnet.

params.name: gatewayId
params.description: If specified, associate the created Route Table with the specified Internet Gateway.

params.name: tags
params.description: If specified, tag the Route Table with the tags specified. Each tag should either be in the format of Key=Value or just Key. To enter multiple values separate each with a new line. Also accepts getting an array of objects in the form of { Key, Value } or { Key }.

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where a route table will be associated

params.name: routeTableId
params.description:
The ID of the route table to associate.

5. Subnet ID (String)Optional- If specified, associate the route table with the specified subnet.

params.name: subnetId
params.description: If specified, associate the route table with the specified subnet.

params.name: gatewayId
params.description: If specified, associate the route table with the specified internet gateway.

params.name: DryRun
params.description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where a volume will be created

params.name: availabilityZone
params.description: The Availability Zone in which to create the volume.

params.name: volumeType
params.description: The volume type.

params.name: size
params.description: The size of the volume, in GBs. You must specify either a snapshot ID or a volume size. If you specify a snapshot, the default is the snapshot size. You can specify a volume size that is equal to or larger than the snapshot size.

params.name: iops
params.description: The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS). Only for volume types io1, io2 and gp3.

params.name: snapshotId
params.description: If specified create the volume from the snapshot specified.

params.name: outpostArn
params.description: If specified create the volume on the outpost specified.

params.name: throughput
params.description: This parameter is valid only for gp3 volumes. The throughput to provision for the volume, with a maximum of 1,000 MiB/s.

params.name: encrypted
params.description: Indicates Whether to encrypt the volume or not. Encryption type depends on the volume origin (new or from a snapshot), starting encryption state, ownership, and whether encryption by default is enabled.

params.name: kmsKeyId
params.description: The identifier of the Key Management Service (KMS) KMS Key to use for Amazon EBS encryption. If this parameter is not specified, your KMS Key for Amazon EBS is used. If KmsKeyId is specified, the encrypted state must be true. You can specify the KMS Key using any of the following: Key ID | Key alias | Key ARN | Alias ARN

params.name: multiAttachEnabled
params.description: Indicates whether to enable Amazon EBS Multi-Attach. If you enable Multi-Attach, you can attach the volume to up to 16 Instances built on the Nitro System in the same Availability Zone. This parameter is supported with io1 and io2 volumes only.

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response. If you have the required permissions, the error response is DryRunOperation. Otherwise, it is UnauthorizedOperation.

params.name: waitForEnd
params.description: Wait until the end of the operation. The operation ends when the volume is ready.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where an EBS snapshot will be created

params.name: volumeId
params.description: The ID of the volume to create the snapshot of.

params.name: description
params.description: A description for the snapshot.

params.name: outpostArn
params.description: If specified, create the snapshot on the outpost specified. Not related to the outpost the volume is stored on.

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response. If you have the required permissions, the error response is DryRunOperation. Otherwise, it is UnauthorizedOperation.

params.name: waitForEnd
params.description: Wait until the end of the operation. The operation ends when the snapshot is completed.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where a security group will be created

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the new security group to create.

params.name: description
params.description: The description of the security group.
params.placeholder: This is my organization's security group.

params.name: vpcId
params.description: The ID of the VPC. Required for EC2-VPC Security Group.

params.name: tags
params.description: If specified, tag the Security Group with the tags specified. Each tag should either be in the format of Key=Value or just Key. To enter multiple values separate each with a new line. Also accepts getting an array of objects in the form of { Key, Value } or { Key }.

params.name: disallowOutboundTraffic
params.description: Disallow any outgoing traffic. Default is false.

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where a security group rule will be added

params.name: groupId
params.description: The ID of the security group to add the rules to.

params.name: ruleType
params.description:
The type of rules to create.
Possible Values are: Ingress-Authorize/Egress-Authorize/Ingress-Revoke/Egress-Revoke. Default Value is Ingress-Authorize.

params.name: cidrIps
params.description: The IP v6 ranges in CIDR notation to apply to the rule(To authorize\revoke). To enter multiple values separate each with a new line.

params.name: cidrIps6
params.description: The IP v6 ranges in CIDR notation to apply to the rule(To authorizeevoke). To enter multiple values separate each with a new line.

params.name: portRanges
params.description: Ranges of allowed ports for this rule. You can specify a range of ports or just one port. Please specify one range per line.

params.name: ipProtocol
params.description: The IP Protocol to apply to this rule(either authorized\revoke access for this protocol).

params.name: icmpType
params.description: ICMP types are used to identify control messages. Use this parameter if you chose ICMP protocol.

params.name: description
params.description: The description of the rules created.
params.placeholder: This is my organization's security group.

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS geographical region where a tag will be created

params.name: resourceId
params.description: AWS ID of the EC2 resource to add the tags to.

params.name: tags
params.description: Tags key=value pairs. Existing keys will be overridden.
